messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
No, somebody just came in and shot my daughter and my husband.
They shot them? Are they conscious?
Please, she's bleeding out. My daughter is bleeding out.
How old is your daughter?
She's 10.
And where were they shot?
In the head. Should I pick her up?
No, no. I want you to leave her where she is.
Okay, what am I going to do? Are they still there?
Do you know who they are?
They're coming back in. They're coming back in.
Let me know. Are you still there? Are you okay?
I don't know, I'm scared. How many people were there?
How many people were there?
I don't know, I was asleep and I can't move. I've been shot myself.
Where were you shot?
I think I'm shot in the leg. I'm not sure.
Are you armed?
Yes.
Okay, they're coming lights and sirens. Did you see any of them?
No, I just got up because they told us that somebody had escaped jail and needed to check my house. Then they shot my husband and my daughter, and they shot me.
They're coming, okay? You said they told your husband they wanted to come in because of an escaped person?
Yes, and that the whole property was surrounded with officers.
Are they still in the house?
I don't know. I'm sitting here bleeding and I have this gun loaded.
What kind of gun do you have?
It's a handgun.
Yeah. Where in the house are you?
I'm in the kitchen, staring at the door.
Are you with your husband and your daughter?
No, I can't look at them.
What kind of vehicles do you have on your property?
I have a black Suburban in the front and a white Ford truck.
Did it sound like males were talking?
There was a man and a shorter woman.
What did the woman look like? Was she Hispanic?
No, she was white.
Okay. And what about the man?
He was tall.
Were there others?
Yes, a Hispanic man too.
Did you see what they were wearing?
Camouflage clothing.
Are you holding up okay? Keep pressure on your wound.
I'm trying. My husband always had a gun in the house just in case.
That's good. Did you hit any of them?
No, they shot at me, and I shot back.
Okay, try to stay calm. We're getting help to you as fast as we can.
I yelled at them to get out, but they just kept shooting.
It's going to be okay. They're almost there. Stay with me.
Please hurry. I don't know how much longer I can hold on.
They should be there any moment. Do you hear or see anything outside?
I hear cars driving up. I hope it's them.
They should announce themselves. Stay with me until they're with you.
Okay, I'm scared.
You're doing great. Just hang in there a little longer.
I hear them. They're here.
Put the gun down and let them come to you.
I'm in the kitchen. I'm on 911.
Tell them you can't move and that you're injured.
Okay, I'm doing that.
They're with me now.
Okay, I'm going to hang up. You're in good hands now.
